鐜鐜鐜

鐜字的基本解释

鐜
duī
下垂。
打夯用的重锤。

鐜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［duì］
［《廣韻》徒對切，去隊，定。］
同“錞1”。“镦1”的繁体字。
(1)矛柄末的平底金属套。
(2)代指矛之类武器。
[②]［duī］
［《集韻》都回切，平灰，端。］
亦作“鐜1”。“镦2”的繁体字。
打夯用的重锤。《说文·金部》：“鐜，下垂也。一曰千斤椎。”段玉裁注：“千斤椎，若今衆舉以築地者是也……按下垂、千斤椎二義皆鐓之餘義。”北魏郦道元《水经注·渭水三》：“秦始皇造橋，鐵鐓重不能勝，故刻石作力士孟賁等像以祭之，鐓乃可移動也。”一说通“墩”。指桥墩。
[③]［dūn］
［《集韻》都昆切，平魂，端。］
“镦3”的繁体字。
(1)冲压金属板，使其变形。不加热叫冷镦，加热叫热镦。
(2)通“驐”。阉割。

鐜字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鐜； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1323第12
【五音集韻】都回切，音磓。同鐓。

鐜字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
鐜字的起名意思

暂无。

鐜
Basic explanation of words
鐜
duī
Sagging.
A heavy hammer used for ramming.
鐜
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［duì］
["Guangyun" only cut, go to the team, set. ]
Same as "錞1". Traditional characters for "镦1".
(1) The flat-bottomed metal sleeve at the end of the shank of the spear.
(2) Refers to weapons such as spears.
[②]［duī］
["Ji Yun" all cut back, flat gray, end. ]
Also known as "鐜1". Traditional characters for "镦2".
A heavy hammer used for ramming. "Shuowen·Jinbu": "Yu, drooping. One is Qianjin spine." Duan Yucai's note: "Qianjin spine, if the people who use Tsukiji today are also...the two meanings of sagging and Qianjin spine are both upsetting. Yu Yi." Northern Wei Dynasty Li Daoyuan's "Shui Jing Zhu Wei Shui III": "Qin Shihuang built a bridge, and iron upsetting was too heavy to win. Therefore, the stone was carved as a memorial to the strong man Meng Ben, and the upsetting can be moved." One said. Same as "Dun". Refers to the bridge pier.
[③]［dūn］
["Jiyun" are all Kunqie, Ping Hun, Duan. ]
Traditional characters for "镦3".
(1) Press the metal plate to deform it. No heating is called cold heading, and heating is called hot heading.
(2) Through "驐". Castration.
鐜
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　鐜; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: page 1323 12
[Five-tone Jiyun] All cut back, Yinhu. Same as upsetting.
鐜
Source glyph
Character evolution: Xiaozhuan
Italics
Font comparison: Song Ti, Mainland China
Taiwan Minutes
Korean Ming Dynasty
鐜
Name meaning
Nothing.
duī, dūn
